sn35.228:1.1: “Mendicants, an uneducated ordinary person speaks of the ocean.
sn35.228:1.2: But that’s not the ocean in the training of the Noble One.
sn35.228:1.3: That’s just a large body of water, a large sea of water.
sn35.228:1.4: For a person, the eye is an ocean,
sn35.228:1.5: and its currents are made of sights.
sn35.228:2.1: Someone who can withstand those currents is said to have crossed over the ocean of the eye, with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters.
sn35.228:2.2: Crossed over, the brahmin stands on the far shore.
sn35.228:2.3: For a person, the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.228:2.8: and its currents are made of thoughts.
sn35.228:2.9: Someone who can withstand those currents is said to have crossed over the ocean of the mind, with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters.
sn35.228:2.10: Crossed over, the brahmin stands on the far shore.”
sn35.228:2.11: That is what the Buddha said.
sn35.228:2.12: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn35.228:3.1: “A knowledge master who’s crossed the ocean so hard to cross,
sn35.228:3.2: with its saltwater crocodiles and monsters, its waves, whirlpools, and dangers;
sn35.228:3.3: they’ve completed the spiritual journey, and gone to the end of the world,
sn35.228:3.4: they’re called ‘one who has gone beyond’.”
